articles.content:
Korean People's Greatest Holidays to Be Commemorated in Bangladesh 
   Pyongyang, January 28 (KCNA) -- An inaugural ceremony of the Bangladeshi national preparatory committee for commemorating the Day of the Sun and February 16 was held on Jan. 21 under the co-sponsorship of the Workers' Party of Bangladesh and the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee.
 Rashed Khan Menon, chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Bangladesh, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee and Nuran Nabie, chairman of the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee, its coordinator.    
 The ceremony discussed the issue of organizing diverse functions to highly praise and give wide publicity to the immortal feats performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on the occasions.

Repression of Japan-resident Koreans Blasted in S. Korea
articles.content:
Repression of Japan-resident Koreans Blasted in S. Korea 
   Pyongyang, January 28 (KCNA) -- The General Student Council of Hansin University, the Tongari Federation, the Student Committee of the Democratic Labor Party and other student movement organizations in south Korea reportedly issued a statement on Jan. 22 denouncing the Japanese authorities' suppression of Koreans in Japan.
 The Japanese authorities are cracking down upon the Koreans in Japan more harshly instead of fully apologizing to the Korean nation for Japan's past crimes, the statement said.    
 All the overseas Koreans including those in Japan should go along the road to the independent and peaceful reunification of the country together in the spirit of the June 15 joint declaration, the statement said, calling on the students to take the lead in the struggle to defend the dignity of the nation.

Reception Given by Indian Ambassador
articles.content:
Reception Given by Indian Ambassador
   Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- Indian Ambassador to the DPRK N. T. Khankhup gave a reception at the Taedonggang Club for the Diplomatic Corps on Friday on the occasion of the 57th anniversary of the Day of the Republic of India.
 Present on invitation were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Ryom Sun Gil, chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea and chairman of the Korea-India Friendship Association, officials concerned and diplomatic envoys of different countries and representatives of international organizations here.    
 Speeches were made at the reception.

Japanese Authorities' Suppression of Chongryon under Fire
articles.content:
Japanese Authorities' Suppression of Chongryon under Fire
   Pyongyang, January 28 (KCNA) -- The Norway-Korea Friendship Association in a statement on Jan. 22 strongly denounced the Japanese police for searching facilities related to the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) without any reason.
 Japan has not apologized for the past crimes it committed in Korea and several other countries and, on the contrary, it is inciting the hostile sentiment toward Korea through media under the patronage of the United States, the statement said.    
 Voices of condemning the Japanese authorities' suppression of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan are recently ringing louder from south Korea, too, it said, stressing the need to check the reactionary moves of Japan so as to defuse the tensions in Asia.
